recommendations.title: Inside the facility where Kodak brings film back to life
recommendations.excerpt: Paul Simon never wrote a song about Kodak Ektachrome, so you’ve probably never heard of it. But you have seen pictures shot on the film: The astronauts brought it to the moon in 1969, and National Geographic photographers have carried it around the globe.

recommendations.title: Inside Amazon’s $3.5 million competition to make Alexa chat like a human
recommendations.excerpt: Onstage at the launch of Amazon’s Alexa Prize, a multimillion-dollar competition to build AI that can chat like a human, the winners of last year’s challenge delivered a friendly warning to 2018’s hopefuls: your bot will mess up, it will say something offensive, and it will be taken offline.

recommendations.title: The Warriors Upped the Stakes This Offseason
recommendations.excerpt: I hate admitting this, but aside from an instant-classic Game 1, I’ve never been more bored watching the NBA Finals.

recommendations.title: The Dangers of Belly Fat
recommendations.excerpt: If your waist measures 35 or more inches for women or 40 or more inches for men, chances are you’re harboring a potentially dangerous amount of abdominal fat.  If you do nothing else today to protect your health, consider taking an honest measurement of your waist.

recommendations.title: 18 Gmail settings that will change how you think about your inbox
recommendations.excerpt: Google recognizes this. The company has packed Gmail with dozens of advanced options that can save you time and add powerful possibilities into your inbox. The only problem is that there are so many of them—scattered across so many places—that it’s all too easy to overlook something useful.

recommendations.title: Meet Erik Finman, the teenage bitcoin millionaire
recommendations.excerpt: Erik Finman is one of the world’s youngest bitcoin millionaires – an achievement he’s not shy about flaunting.

recommendations.title: Lowe: Kevin Durant stands apart among all-time greats
recommendations.excerpt: As Kevin Durant and his father, Wayne Pratt, parted Saturday morning in Cleveland after an all-night celebration, Durant drew Pratt close and cited a statistic he had seen pairing Durant and Michael Jordan as two of the only players with four scoring titles and two Finals MVP awards.

recommendations.title: The market for driverless cars will head towards monopoly
recommendations.excerpt: THE race to bring driverless cars to market is fierce and crowded. All the leading carmakers are in the field: on May 31st SoftBank’s Vision Fund said that it would invest $2.25bn in the autonomous vehicle (AV) arm of General Motors.

recommendations.title: World Cup Preview 2018: Messi vs. Ronaldo, Magic Cats, Iceland!!, and the Entire Emotional Context in Which Much of Human Life Transpires
recommendations.excerpt: Ladies and gentlemen, start your psychic octopuses.

recommendations.title: The Ascension of Cauliflower
recommendations.excerpt: Food companies are capitalizing on the low-carb, gluten-free trend by using vegetables like cauliflower to replace flour, rice and other simple carbs.

recommendations.title: My First Drive After Cancer
recommendations.excerpt: Half a mile from home, on my very first drive since my doctor forbade me from getting behind the wheel a month previously, I was cut off while in the middle of a wide right turn.   I slammed on the brakes and just barely let the beat-up old F-150 into my lane without incident.

recommendations.title: Feel Busy All the Time? There’s an Upside to That.
recommendations.excerpt: Imagine yourself at a restaurant, trying to decide between two desserts: a chocolate cake and a fruit bowl. You’ve been trying to eat healthier, but the cake just sounds so tasty… What do you do?  As it turns out, your decision is likely to be influenced by how busy you perceive yourself to be.

recommendations.title: Dead Golf Courses Are the New NIMBY Battlefield
recommendations.excerpt: As the sport’s popularity wanes, vast amounts of underutilized land will open up. Can it be developed?  Golf is dying, many experts say. According to one study by the golf industry group Pellucid Corp., the number of regular golfers fell from 30 to 20.9 million between 2002 and 2016.

recommendations.title: LeBron can hit free agency again, and anything is possible
recommendations.excerpt: This LeBron James free-agency decision is going to be his most personal.  When he went to Miami in 2010, it was about business; he badly needed to become a champion. When he returned to Cleveland in 2014, in what he hoped was his last move, it was about legacy.

recommendations.title: Domino's Is Fixing America's Crappy Roads For Pizza Safety And That's Pretty Embarrassing
recommendations.excerpt: This feels like something from a William Gibson cyberpunk dystopia novel, where the government has become so weak and useless, private corporations have been taking over the basic upkeep of the nation.

recommendations.title: Piece by Piece, a Factory-Made Answer for a Housing Squeeze
recommendations.excerpt: VALLEJO, Calif. — California is in the middle of an affordable-housing crisis that cities across the state are struggling to solve. Rick Holliday, a longtime Bay Area real estate developer, thinks one answer lies in an old shipyard in Vallejo, about 40 minutes northeast of San Francisco.

recommendations.title: The Strange Case of the Missing Joyce Scholar
recommendations.excerpt: Some 16 years ago, The Boston Globe published an article about a jobless man who haunted Marsh Plaza, at the center of Boston University. The picture showed a curious figure in a long overcoat, hunched beneath a black fedora near the central sculpture.

recommendations.title: Want Your Child To Eat (Almost) Everything? There Is A Way
recommendations.excerpt: Experts will tell you that if you want to raise a kid who eats just about everything, you should feed them what you eat — assuming you're eating a varied, healthy diet. It's what most cultures have done for most of human history.  But American culture sends parents a very different message.

recommendations.title: How George Orwell Predicted the Challenge of Writing Today
recommendations.excerpt: The following is adapted from a lecture delivered in Barcelona at the Centre de Cultura Contemporània de Barcelona on June 6, 2018, in honor of Orwell Day.  Some essays are letters into the future.

recommendations.title: The little-known behavioral scientist who transformed cities all over the world
recommendations.excerpt: “Why are you architects not interested in people?” Ingrid Gehl asked her new husband, Jan. “What do you think about the fact that your architecture professors take their photos at four o’clock in the morning . . .
